inn1.comm: full and slides down the leg side, so he starts with a wide
much better delivery, and loud appeal for lbw! Full outside off, nips back at Jayawardene who is playing across the line and is taken above the knee roll. So height an issue
short of a length, good pace, he defends off the back foot to the leg side
fuller, on middle off, Jayawardene shuffles across the crease and defends to the leg side
feeling away from his body a touch, a short of a length delivery, and his feet don't really move. A little tentative
more in control this time as he steers a back-of-a-length delivery wide of second slip to third man
edged! But doesn't carry. A full ball outside off, draw Dilshan forward, it was a thick edge but ended up falling quite a way short of Jordan
full on off stump, defended back down the pitch
nice delivery, beats him on the inside edge as Jayawardene comes forward to drive
left alone outside off
leans forward and carefully drives to mid-off
touch shorter, on off stump, he goes onto the back foot and defends into the covers
in the channel outside off, Jayawardene content to shoulder arms...a impressive start from Woakes, too
back of a length, nips back into Dilshan and strikes him in the stomach...that will sting at Finn's pace
on off stump, defended into the covers
flay and a miss! Dilshan doesn't like dot balls, sees a hint of width of Finn and tries to cut but it was still too close to his body
that's a beauty! Back of a length, nips away and bounces past Dilshan's outside as he's pushing away from his body
comes forward and drives to the covers, Bopara dives to make the stop but loses the grip on the ball as he aims for a shy
takes another one on the body which nips, drops into the leg side. Testing stuff.
full on middle and off, he's pretty static in the crease as he defends and gets a thick inside edge to the leg side
slightly shorter, works this into square leg
full outside off, he drives and gets a think inner part of the bat to mid-on...moved after the shot, which suggests his balance wasn't quite right
some relief for the batsmen, Woakes drops it too short and it is angling towards the hip so Jayawardene is able to tuck it off the pads to fine leg

but gone next ball! Woakes pitches it touch fuller and Jayawardene gets completely squared up as he aims to play to the leg side, the leading edge looping to mid-off. The ball appeared to stop in the surface, as well as straighten
back of a length on middle and off, defended to backward point
full on the stumps, whipped to the right of mid-off
uncertainty for Sangakkara now as he defends at a length delivery and he is unsure where the inside edge has gone, but it runs back down the pitch
there's a man in form...albeit a full toss, but Sangakkara dispatches it through the covers with ease
drags the length back, defended to midwicket
full outside off, left alone
full, punched back down the pitch where Finn gets his right hand on it
tight on off stump, all defence back to the bowler
punched off the back foot into the covers...Dilshan hasn't been given any width, yet
short of a length outside off, this is nicely timed with a square drive off the back foot but Morgan intercepts at point...good back-up for the bowler
super delivery, fuller this time, hint of movement away and Dilshan prods for it without much convinction
dragged down shorter, Dilshan pulls through midwicket but deep square is able to get around
full outside off, driven to short cover
he cuts loose at last, throws the kitchen sink into a full delivery and drives it through the covers

big appeal for lbw! Full and nips back, Dilshan falls across his shot, appears to be heading down the leg side but Cook has reviewed. That's just a waste. Will barely be clipping, I think. Yep, just skimming top of leg. Never looked that straight.
whipping across the line again, makes contact this time and finds deep square
comes forward and drives on the up into the covers but can't find a gap
in the air! But doesn't reach mid-off. He's keen to drive, but doesn't keep this down but it hasn't quite got the legs to reach Root
back of a length outside off, defended into the off side
drives on the up to the left of mid-off
defended to the off side
tight on middle and off, defended
hint of width outside off, cut firmly to backward point
comes round the wicket, defended onto the covers
works with the angle from round the wicket and tucks it wide of deep square so he can make a second
extra from Finn from quite a fill length, Dilshan working towards the leg side and gets a top edge into his chest
and that's the problem for Finn, slides one down the leg side
another one nips back at Dilshan and brings  a strangled lbw short, going over stumps, but that ball appeared to disturb the surface
and again, Finn is asking. But he's the only one. Dilshan, though, is having trouble making contact as he's taken on the pad aiming through midwicket
comes forward and defended to mid-off
goes for a pull and gets a cue-end which runs down towards third man (more chalk, please)...he's making it look hard work at the moment
defended into the off side
full outside off, opens the face towards backward point where Morgan can't quite prevent the run
round the wicket, short of a length, flicks the thigh pad through to Buttler which prevents a wide (although England appealed for the catch)
opens the face into the off side
another lbw appeal as Dilshan is, again, taken on the pad...missing leg, he'll have a bruised knee tonight
driven into the off side, beats the diving short cover and is just far enough to the right of Bopara
full on off stump, worked to midwicket
fetched from outside off, down the ground to long on
round the wicket, comes forward and gets a thick inside edge into square leg
defended on the back foot to the leg side
oh dear! That's come out as a massive full toss. Called no-ball.
quicker, wider outside off and Dilshan quickly latches on and back-cuts through short third man
uses his feet then clips from outside off to midwicket
big spin! This has ripped and ragged from outside off, spun past Dilshan's inside edge has plays forward then flies over the stumps
around the wicket, touch short outside off, cut to deep point
fuller, this one grips and takes a thickish outside edge into the off side
flicked to short midwicket
comes down the pitch outside off, flicks with with bottom hand but can't beat Tredwell
finds square leg this time
a bonus run for Sri Lanka, Dilshan tucked it to deep square and the return from Finn hit the non-striker's stumps and no one could stop the rebound
in the air, but he places it very well. Short and wide first up, Sangakkara drives square behind point and Moeen can't get around from third man
tighter to off stump, defended into the covers
back of a length outside off, defended towards point
gets across onto off stump, defended into the covers
undoes the work of the dot balls, loses his line into the pads and it is delightfully flicked behind square and beats long leg
width outside off again, but cut straight to point
uses his feet, drives to mid-off
flicked from outside off to square leg
nurdled around the corner from outside off to short fine leg
round the wicket, full on middle, defended
head over the ball, played back to the bowler
nifty footwork as he skips out of his crease then eases a drive along the ground to long off
drives off the back foot with an open face and it runs down to third man
driven to the cover sweeper
short of a length, angled into the pads, deflects behind square on the leg side
back of a length outside off, worked into the leg side, he started for a single but realised it wasn't on
full outside off, driven to the covers
he almost swings himself off his feet try to reach a wide delivery...careful not to do yourself an injury
adjust the line, defended to the covers
round the wicket, comes down the pitch but he's not to the pitch so just kicks it away
fuller on middle, defended
ooh, drives and a gets a think inside edge into his pad which then runs into the off side
worked along the ground to deep midwicket and that's excellent running by two senior figures
on off stump, defended
more good footwork and a punchy drive down the ground to long off
opens the face down to third man
full outside off, punch-and-run to mid-off...had to get a scamper on
round the wicket to the left hander, dabbed towards backward point who can't prevent the single
full and driven to mid-off
drives it hard into the pitch, bounces just to evade Jordan's leap in his follow through...mid-off gathers and hits with an under-arm flick, but Dilshan is well home
short of a length, angled down to third man
defended to the off side
this one skids through and nearly has him in trouble as he tries to cut
defended to the on side
cut into the off side and Stokes, on as a sub, is at backward point
terrific footwork to relieve some of the pressure, two steps down the pitch and clean swing over long on
tucked into the leg side
comes forward and defends
short of a length, goes on the back foot and works into the leg side but can't find the gap
again, can't find a gap in the leg side
frustration getting to Dilshan as he aims a huge slog-sweep from outside off but the ball skids below his bottom edge
something gentler to end the over as he tickles a single to short fine leg
this time he gets the slog-sweep away, connects pretty cleaning as he sends it just in front of square...Woakes is a bit uncertain whether attempt a catch or not, he wouldn't have got there
defended to the on side
down the pitch and hacks to long on

now Sangakkara goes over the leg side again, comes out out of his and sends it over straight deep midwicket. James Taylor pulls out a full-length dive to try and grab it, but the ball was always heading wide of him
comes forward and defends
a reverse sweep to deep cover...as you do
driven off the back foot to cover
flicked from off stump down to long on
nicely flighted from round the wicket, defended with bat and pad together
walks onto the shot, defends to the covers
leans forward, opens the face, drives to cover...tidy over from Tredwell
continuing to milk runs down the ground, good milking
flicked from outside off along the ground through midwicket
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
a rare occasion of Sangakkara losing some shape on a shot as he comes down the pitch and his bottom hand comes off the bat as he finds mid-on
into the leg side
another one spins past his inside edge, this from round the wicket, and deflects of Buttler for byes
short, spins away, Sangakkara just manages to catch up with a toe-ends to cover
full on middle and off, defended
driven off the back foot to the cover sweeper
goes back in the crease and tucks a straight delivery to midwicket
whips it past a diving Tredwell down to long on
fired in very full, dug out back to the bowler
full on off stump, pushed into the off side
slow, wicket-to-wicket, driven to cover
worked off the pads to Jordan at midwicket
dragged down a fraction, pulled out to deep midwicket without much timing due to the lack of pace
dropped, and it's the captain! Cook has shelled Sangakkara, who drove in the air straight to mid-off. What a moment that could be. Was fraction early on the shot. It was a simple chance.
now he has a heave across the line and gets a inside edge close to his stumps. Bopara in a touch of dispair
chipped in the air down to long on
full outside off, driven to cover
appeal for lbw as he's again playing around his front pad...not a millions away, maybe outside the line. No reviews left anyway
and now he switch hits over backward point, picks up a length delivery and deposits it to the ropes
flicked to square leg
worked out to deep midwicket
full on off stump, opens the face towards point
lobbed into the off side, in the air for a while but not close to any of the fielders
it's a charmed few moments for Sangakkara, now he's swinging across the line at a wide delivery outside off and gets a think edge towards third man
wide outside off, Dilshan cuts and it takes a thick bottom edge fine of third man
full, driven to mid-off
cut firmly to backward point
full around off stump, flicked past midwicket into the deep
back on the stumps and it skidded on from around the wicket, kept out at the last moment to backward point
more air and lifted gently down the ground to long-on, perfectly safe
wide on the crease, turned with the angle wide of short long leg but Sangakkara refused the run for some reason
around the wicket, tucked from a straight line out through square leg, just a single as deep square was in quickly
down the track, not to the pitch, cloths it down the ground and short of long-off, the latest moment of fortune for Sangakkara
not luck about this stroke though, too short and pulled hard wide of deep midwicket, ANOTHER fifty for Sangakkara, remarkable
this is a full toss, smashed only off low on the bat down to long-on
full on the off stump, pushed up to short extra cover
tad short and Dilshan gets across his stumps to turn it backward of square and away for four more, Dilshan to a half-century now
dabs off side but too close to point for a single
fuller length and flicked down to long-on
length a touch wide of off stump, slapped out to deep cover
fourth-stump line on a length, stays put in the crease, opens the face and runs it very fine indeed and gets four, glorious touch, thought it had to be an edge to start with
touch fuller and pressed into the covers this time
length sliding into the pads and this is helped on it's way wide of long leg
back over the wicket, full sliding across the left-hander, presses to extra cover
drops the length back a touch, dropped wide of cover and they take a quick single
firm press from just outside off down to long-off
slog swept and missed completely, struck too high on the pad for the lbw cry
down the wicket and an ugly slap off a thick inside edge runs down to long-on, threw kitchen sink at that
a step down the track and glorious little lift over mid-on, great batting
just a tad short now, waited for and cut hard past backward point
fuller length and just blocked back to the bowler
full at the pads, clipped down to long leg
a step down the wicket, slaps a mistimed drive to mid-on and they take on the fielder and get home very comfortably
good length at the off stump, driven steadily to extra cover
tad fuller but driven to extra cover again
tight line again, pressed into the covers once more
wider line but Jordan gets away with it, this is only driven as far as deep cover
goes for the switch hit and heaves it behind deep cover, great shot
a shimmy down and knocked out to long-on
a little air, punched down to long-off and the 150 comes up
stays around, flicked leg side from around middle and off
another switch hit, this time a top edge into the chest
down the wicket squeezing out to long-on
comes down and tries to flick leg side, this comes off the pad wide of point for a leg bye
down the track and Sangakkara just kicks it away
this time closer to the pitch and works it wide enough of long-off for a second run
swept steadily from off stump out to deep midwicket
wide on the crease off stump line, clipped to midwicket
off stump, angled to backward point just wide enough of him for a single
around the wicket, poked from outside off straight to midwicket
back again and dabbed not far enough away from midwicket again
a shimmy down, opens up the off side and strikes firmly in the gap between mid-off and extra-cover, fabulous stroke, timed it perfect, the stand is now 150
waited for in the crease and tries to tuck leg side but is struck on the pad
goes leg side again but only finds square leg
this skids onto the pad just outside leg stump
full length, firm punch down to long-off

down the track, slaps it down the ground but doesn't get in and holes out to long-on! Straight to Bopara, so Dilshan's lovely innings come to an end and England make the breakthrough. Dilshan didn't get to the pitch and got a thick inside edge that flew straight to the fielder who took a simple catch, no mistake this time
forward blocking off a thick inside edge to midwicket
forward just outside off, blocked coming forward
forward again trying to steer this off side, only tucked to short third man who's in quickly
swept from the off stump out to deep square
yorker but a foot down the leg side
length on off stump, pressed back up the wicket
oh goodness, back of a length, Prasanna opens the front foot and flat bats it over long-on! A huge strike, incredible
full at the leg stump, big swing leg side but misses and gets hit on the pad which runs to square leg
around the wicket, slower ball on the stumps, carefully dropped into midwicket and they take an easy run

length on the stumps, another leg side heave, this goes a long way up but nowhere near far enough...but it lands in the gap! So so lucky. Short of deep midwicket running in and long of square leg running back
full on the stumps, clipped out to deep square
around the wicket, just back of a length on the off stump, angles wide of point

another leg side heave, another slice right up in the air, Buttler goes charging out across towards square leg and drops the chance! Had he left it for James Taylor it was a simple catch but Buttler with the mitts thought it should be his catch but in the end, Taylor had to back away to make room for Buttler's dive which wasn't in time in the end
length at the body and flicked over long leg! A little pick up shot and timed superbly
back of a length and a delicate paddle runs fine of short leg leg

another slog, mistimed again and this time caught. It was a slower ball that Prasanna tried to heave away again but he got a thick outside edge that only looped to point and Morgan made no mistake - Buttler's error not costing England too many
length at the body, angled out towards point and they get a single
low full toss just outside off, driven only as far as Bopara on the edge of the circle at cover
full at the off stump, touched into midwicket
full again, nudged up from the off stump to extra-cover
shuffle down the crease, Woakes goes tight at the body and cramps the batsman up who can only nudge it back to the bowler
very full, squeezed down to long-on
full again, clipped down to long-on
around the wicket, slower ball, back of a length, helped around the corner out to deep square

length down the leg side, taken by Buttler and an immediate appeal and given out caught behind! Mathews walks off. He shuffled across his stumps a little and tried to leg glance this but got a tickle to Buttler who went straight up and Mathews walked straight off, a big wicket
back of a length, it nibbles away a little, Chandimal wasn't 100% in control but got bat and gloves inside the line
fuller on the stumps, tucked down to long leg
length on a straight line, Sangakkara stays leg side of it and punches to deep cover
full on a fourth-stump line, played forward to and angles out down to long leg
full at the off stump, flicked to mid-on
fuller length, nudged only back to the bowler
finds the fielder again, pressing forward just outside off to extra-cover
straight line and whipped right across it down to long leg, Woakes knows he was very close to sneaking that through
length around the off stump, dabbed just behind point and they take a single
back of a length and pulled well and wide of Bopara scrambling to his right from deep midwicket, 200 up
around the wicket and a wide ball outside off, driven handsomely through the covers, poor ball with a heavily-packed leg side field
yorker length, tries to dig it out, missed I think, there's an appeal from Buttler and they will check for caught behind here but these are always bump-balls and yep the replay confirms as such
full length wide of off stump, driven at and gets a thick inside edge that flies past off stump and past Buttler's right hand to the fine fine fine leg fence
slightly shorter length, waited for and angled down to third man
forward press on off stump, a thick inside edge runs out to deep square
full ball slides down the leg side
width outside off stump, carved wide of third man and they get back for the second
skip down the wicket and clips this out to long-on
around the wicket, a firm punch down to long-off from a strong forward press
down the track, beaten in the flight and a missed stumping. But it was incredibly tough because it flicked the bat and whistled past Buttler's right hand, would have been a miraculous take
forward playing from just outside off into midwicket
finds midwicket again having taken a step down the track now
once more pressing to midwicket playing with the turn
length ball sliding across the lefite who angles down to third man
length, aims a huge swing towards the centre of town but gets a thick inside edge into the body
down the wicket, flicks leg side and gets it wide of long leg, such power there
shoulders arms as this slips down leg, not quite as bad for England with the wides today...but there's still time!
full slower ball, knocked up in front of mid-on for an easy single
stroked out to cover and there's the century! Sangakkara's first at Pallekele and his 20th ODI ton, a superb innings capping his fine form this series. But remember he was very badly dropped on 41
good length at the stumps, blocked back to the bowler
gets across his stumps and sweep behind square on the leg side, great batting
floated up, a swing outside off stump and it turns and bounces out of the rough, beats outside edge and Buttler and skips away to the fine third man fence
aims another sweep at this, it started well outside off and turned sharply away again, a harsh wide
fuller ball, swept again, runs off the pad into the covers
tossed right up a foot outside off, squeezed out to deep cover
heaved off the stumps to deep midwicket, didn't get hold of that
floated up outside off, aiming leg side again, sweeps this straight to midwicket but they take the fielder on because he's right back on the edge of the circle
goes for a scoop, gets it off the toe into the leg side, Chandimal wants a single that's never there and had Jordan hit the stumps Chandimal was miles out at the non-striker's end
clears the front leg and strokes a full length ball with awesome timing over long-on

gives himself room again, aiming over the off side this time but picks out cover. And Sangakkara gives a long salute to the crowd as he walks off, his last innings here more than likely. Didn't get the timing right on this occasion and clothed a cut straight to Moeen Ali on the edge of the circle
length on the stumps, dabbed into midwicket, easy single
bumper, it drifts leg side as the batsman ducks beneath it
good length cramps the batsman who waits for it to come on and angles out down to third man
back of a length ball dropped into the covers, they taken on Moeen and he misfields so they get home very comfortably
too short and swung over the covers, poor ball really, clubbed well enough
short again, tries to slap off side again but this time cover gets down to save well
length at the stumps, tucked to backward square and they take off for the single
yorker wide of off stump, missed trying to drive
and again, this is Tim Southee-esque and perfectly executed
slower ball on off stump, driven straight to cover
short ball at the body pulled behind deep square
short again, goes off side this time and carves it out into the deep, another meaty strike, the fielder had just come in from deep cover

goes to swing this away again and gets it off high on the bat straight to mid-off. Perera was trying to slap it straight down the ground I think but got no kind of reasonable connection and this time Alastair Cook made no mistake, getting down low by his right boot to take the catch
full at the stumps, tucked leg side, misfield from midwicket brings a single
full on the stumps, this is clipped out to deep square
around the wicket, full length just outside off, a thick inside edge runs out to long leg
length just outside off, tries to swing this leg side but gets no real connection to cover
full on the stumps, Chandimal clears the front leg and clubs it down the ground, straight back pas the bowler, well struck
length ball, it was a slower one, turned out down to long leg
a decent short ball, Mendis going to hook got into a horrible position, struck on the head on Wednesday remember
another slower ball, turned out from a straight line to deep midwicket
walks to the leg side, bowler follows him and pushed into the deep midwicket area, they charge back for the second and full-length dive his needed for Chandimal to get back home but get back he did
around the wicket, short and pulled only as far as deep square leg
back of a length at the body, swung away leg side and it finds the gap between deep square and long leg
fuller and nudged out to deep midwicket
finally a yorker that the batsman gets in a tangle trying to squeeze it away on the leg side, stuck on the pad and it goes nowhere
another length ball to clean at and only a diving save from Cook to his left at mid-off prevents four more
very full on the stumps, swung out to deep midwicket for a sin...oh a fumble from Moeen and there's a second
back of a length, tried to follow the batsman backing away but he's able to swing it away and finds the gap wide of long leg
yorker length and the batsman is struck on the ankle looking to clip leg side, they get a single via an edge to midwicket
follows the batsman backing away, very full, it's pressed leg side and they're coming back whatever, good running, get home easily
slower ball on a length, pulled out to deep square for just a single this time
very full length just outside off, swung out to deep midwicket, straight to the fielder only a single
yorker length and  aiming off side. Very full and very straight - amazing how simple the game can be sometimes. Chandimal misses leaning across having backed to leg and loses his off stump

inn2.comm: round the wicket, on off stump, Cook comes forward and gets a inside edge to the leg side
a languid drive from Moeen who eases into a full delivery and glides it to long off

his day gets no better! Shuffling across his crease, it's a short of a length delivery which angles into him and strikes him on the thigh pad. Umpire raises his finger quickly and Cook doesn't consider the review. His problems continue to mount. Replays show that it was giving leg stump a solid whack
whipped to midwicket
lovely bowling, held back a fraction slow, Moeen is lunging forward and gets an inside edge
and then this one grips a touch more and takes a thick outside edge along the ground to point. Classy stuff from Senanayake.
full and dig out to mid-on
uses his feet and whips out to deep midwicket
round the wicket, full on the stumps, defended
driven down the ground to long off
just a touch of width outside, Taylor goes onto the back foot and late cuts - perhaps a bit more edge than he planned - and it runs down to third man
worked off the pads to short fine leg
close leave! Looped up just outside off and Moeen opted not to play, the ball went on with the air
chopped into the off side
now he has a swing across the line, not the first again spin in this series, and is beaten under the bottom
attempted slog sweep, takes the bottom edge into his back leg and bounces out to slip
drives in the air through midwicket, again not off the middle...not in control at the moment, Moeen
round the wicket, uses his feet but doesn't get to the pitch so defends
defended into the off side
lovely bowling, beats the outside edge. Caught on the back foot and he was feeling for the ball away from his body
now he's beaten on the top as he plays a half-hearted cut, the delivery gripping and bouncing
gets more solidly forward this time, head over the ball, into the off side
patted into the covers
a nicely-controlled flick from outside off along the ground through straight midwicket
tight! Round the wicket, pushed into the off side and Moeen had to get his skates on to make sure he was safe
that's what we've seen from Moeen the last few weeks, a flowing lofted cover drive played with effortless grace
quicker ball, slides on, trapped between bat and pad
played into the off side
dropped a touch short, but Moeen's cut picks out cover
forward and defends
full on middle, defended on the back foot
whipped off the back foot through midwicket
picks this up from outside off with a strong slog-sweep and deposits it over the deep midwicket boundary
tries a repeat, but that was superbly bowled as it was much slower and he also dragged the length back. Comprehensively beaten
now he goes inside out over extra cover, a flat, skimming six...when they come out of the middle they look so good from Moeen
same again, full outside off, driven in the air over cover but this it doesn't quite have the height so skids into the boundary after one bounce
close! Taylor came down the pitch, the ball bounced and struck his hip which meant it just eluded Sangakkara to prevent a stumping chance
down the pitch, lofted straight down the ground although not quite out of the middle

oh, wonderful stuff from Senanayake who has done Taylor all ends up. It was the delivery going on with the arm, Taylor came the pitch and was probably looking for turn. Instead the ball slides past the edge into off stump
almost another leading edge, Root playing across the line at his first delivery
flicked out to deep square
dragged down short, Moeen rocks back and scythes it away between cover and point
full at the stumps, strongly driven down the pitch but Dilshan flings himself to his his left
defended to the leg side
goes back and works to midwicket
almost got into a tangle playing back to quite a full delivery, just gets the bottom of the bat down
flicked off his hip to square leg
another tight run! Direct hit could have been trouble for Moeen after Root turned this off his pads into midwicket
flicked to midwicket
goes for a reverse sweep, picks out short third man
uses his feet then flicks out to deep midwicket
attempts another slog sweep, but he's defeated by a delivery which is held back
now this one grips and spins past the outside edge, this is lovely bowling
a careful forward defence to end the over. Take a breath.
worked to square leg
gets this just wide of square leg so they are able to rotate the strike
angled down the leg side, Moeen goes for the sweep and it comes off a bottom edge and runs very fine, very quickly
strides out of his crease then slog sweeps a full delivery to deep midwicket
flicked off the stumps to square leg
a crackerjack! A ripper from Dilshan. Gripped off a length, bounced and feathered Moeen's glove has he, perfectly understandably, came forward. Not much he could have done, really.
but it's gotta pitch to turn, full toss ran wide of mid-on
carefully forward playing with an inside edge fine of square leg
Root shaped to play leg side here but it turned and he adjusted to defend in front of off stump
this slides on with Root back, gets an inside edge backward of square leg
tucked out leg side for a sharp single backward of square
well forward dropping this in front of point for a sharp single
around the wicket, Root back and clipping to midwicket
too leg side a line and Root rather has a free swing at it, sweep well and gets it backward of square
firm press on off stump, it turns an takes a thick inside edge to midwicket
back now deliberately playing to midwicket

swept off leg stump, misses, it pitched outside leg surely, not out given but Sri Lanka review. Dilshan is very confident but around the wicket this has clearly pitched well outside leg stump. Sri Lanka have been useless with the reviews this series and here's another burnt review - undermines the whole system when you use them as poorly as that
back on the off stump defended up the wicket
back tucking nicely past midwicket
waited for and pressed out into the covers
touch wider line, slashed past point and they run hard for two before the deep cover can get around
back dropping this through square leg
floated right up, driven with good timing but straight to extra cover
wider line and Bopara drives up and over extra cover this time, decent stroke, got enough elevation over the fielder and good timing
begins well wide of off stump, this is left alone
similarly wide but again just inside the guideline as Root again shoulders arms
back pressing out down to third man
forcing stroke of the back foot finds backward point, Dilly with a smart save
straight line, poked through square leg

pressed a long way outside off, a genuine nick and right between keeper and slip! Huge luck for Root who was playing a real nothing stroke at this, defending a long way away from his body, it was a good edge but down and away from both Sangakkara and Jayawardene who were both diving in vain
floated up on the stumps, tucked leg side and they steal a quick single
back on the stumps working this through square leg
fuller length, ran back to the bowler
giving it every chance in the air, Bopara nudging into the covers from just outside off stump
more air, driven at and gets a thick outside edge to point
tighter line and Bopara just covers up again
length at the off stump, angled down to third man
just outside off, Bopara forcing on the back foot gets a thick inside edge to square leg
length ball two feet wide of off stump, Bopara wafts at it, sort of cutting, and misses
full at the off stump, Bopara forward to block out into the covers
back playing a firm stroke up towards extra-cover
back out wide of off stump and Bopara chases it again, more of a drive this time, gets it up and and over point, decent stroke
full length on off stump, ran carefully to extra-cover
straighter and worked down to long-on
forward on the stumps, it skids on and Bopara gets a thick inside edge backward of square leg, they look for two but the deep fielder is in quickly
waiting on off stump, Root nudges out on the off side
right back on the stumps, this skids on and hits Root bang in front of off stump, was it bat or glove first? The umpire says not out, and Sri Lanka have already burned their review
slog swept and missed as it turns away from the off stump
full length, defended back to the bowler

wider line and driven at, edged to the keeper! A tumbling catch but Sangakkara looks hurt. I think he's got the catch but Sangakkara went to ground and didn't celebrate. He's lost the ball but it's slid down his arms and stayed above ground so Bopara has to go and Sangakkara gets away with what should have been a straightforward take down to his right. I think he fell on the ball so was nursing a bang to his chest but whatever happened he claimed the catch. More on the stroke, it was a wild drive from Bopara without foot movement. The delivery left him a little and took a solid outside edge

oh what a beauty! Back of a length lifts on Morgan and he gloves it behind! Pretty much unplayable first up. Right on line sliding across the left-hander but the extra bounce saw Morgan trying to fend it off and he got a thin glove to the keeper. Perfect delivery and this time no drama with the catch
full on the stumps and Buttler shrugs off the threat of a hat-trick to ease a glorious on-drive for four
nice riposte, good length just outside off, Buttler beaten prodding forward
fuller and straighter, nudged up to mid-off
some air just outside off, Root forward running this out through to deep cover
drift in and sharp spin away beating the outside edge, lovely bowling
touch fuller, Buttler presses out through covers
back letting this come on before dabbing to point
waits again on the back foot and turns in front of short long leg
a little full, pressed inside mid-on and they get a sharp single
a foot and a half wide of off stump, left alone, a hint of away swing there
tightens the line and Buttler defends
tight to off stump, popped out into the covers for a sharp single
drags the length back slightly so Root can only defend this into the off side
low full toss on the stumps, clipped out wide of long leg and they get back for a second
this darts through quite low and beats Root outside off stump
a powerful reverse sweep, taken off the stumps and he rolled his wrists to ensure he kept the ball completely along the floor...super stroke
driven out to short cover
a little shorter and quicker, defended on the back foot
fuller, opens the face drives backward of point
nudged into the leg side
comes forward and drives to the cover sweeper
full at middle and leg, drilled very firmly back to Lakmal who parries it away in front of his face
back of a length outside off, Buttler plays a rather wafty, nothing stroke and gets beaten
this is much more sweetly driven, but straight to mid-off
comes down the pitch and tucks this through midwicket...for this pair it's a comfortable two runs
well, this would have tested Buttler's speed! He dropped the ball towards mid-on and went for the run, Perera ran in but then couldn't collect the ball for an under-arm flick
comes forward, opens the face and finds third man
nearly spoons a catch to covers, playing off the back foot to a shorter delivery which sits in the pitch
fuller, tight to off stump, opens the face and runs this down through short third man
flicked off the pads to deep square leg
driven out to deep cover
paddle-sweeps a straight delivery through short fine leg
low full toss outside off and it's given the treatment by Root who drives it through the off side, finding the sizeable gap between deep cover and long off
driven off the back foot down the ground
full on leg stump, flicked to square leg
a shorter delivery, played off the back foot down to long on
huge appeal! A few screaming Sri Lankans. It was very full, takes Buttler on the boot but it may have slid past leg stump or even pitched just outside
worked into the leg side
driven off the back foot to deep cover
full outsdie off, driven strongly through backward point but Jeevan Mendis is very quick at third man and he ensures Root has to get a wriggle on
opens the face down to third man
full outside off, pushed firmly to the sweeper

brilliant fielding! Buttler dropped the ball into the off side, he wanted the run but Root sent him back fairly quickly. Thirimanne swooped from cover and produced a direct hit almost with a back-handed throw as he still in a diving motion
play and a miss, beaten by the extra pace
off the mark to third man
full on middle, defended
driven towards short cover
full and dug out to mid on
finds space this time, drives to long off
nearly in trouble on the back foot, the ball doesn't really bounce and it comes off the toe end
played back to the bowler
full outside off, drives and gets a thick outside edge down to third man
trying to run this down to third man and gets beaten
guided down to third man
short delivery, Woakes for the pull and gets a bottom edge into his stomach. Was early on the stroke
reaches out for a full, wide delivery and drives nicely through the off side
now that's a stroke! A textbook cover drive from Woakes as he comes forward and rifles the stroke between cover and mid-off
full and worked to midwicket
driven to cover
drifts outside leg stump and Root plays an excellent sweep behind square...all along the ground, rolling the wrists
comes forward and defends
low full toss, opens his stance and drives to long off
flicked off the stumps behind square on the leg side
short and wide, cracked very firmly off the back foot in front of square to the sweeper
opens the face to third man
dispatches another short ball with a vicious pull stroke, he saw the length so early that he played it straight of mid-on
this one isn't quite so convincing, through the shot early and gets the toe end down to third man
fuller and flicked to midwicket
full outside off, comes forward and drives firmly to mid-off
round the wicket, dragged down short outside off, cut to deep point
played off the back foot back to the bowler
short again, pulled out to deep square leg and takes Root to another fifty, from 69 balls
full delivery, slides off the face to backward point
down the pitch, flicked nearly in the air over midwicket and biscets the gap between two deep fielders
quicker delivery on the stumps, defended
short outside off, carved through the off side
dragged into the leg side off something that sounded nothing like the middle of the bat
much better connection this time, dragged down short again - a long hop - and it gets pulled over wide mid-on
low full toss which is swept straight to backward square leg
short again and hammered through midwicket, freebies for Waokes and he's cashing in
short outside off this time, but it only gets slapped into the off side...pretty ordinary over, to be polite
over the wicket, swept from outside to deep square
round the wicket, flicked off the stumps to midwicket
short of a length, whipped off the pads to deep square

he's been given lbw playing a reverse sweep! Root has reviewed straight away. Where did it pitch? Close to the glove, but don't think he's hit it. The umpire wanting a lot of replays, including a split screen. I'm never quite sure why they don't just check pitching first. And it's pitching just outside leg stump. Somehow, I feel that decision could have been reached a lot quicker. But, anyway
worked off the back foot through square leg
full and flicked to midwicket
nearly a run out! It was short and pulled to short fine leg, the throw was beating Root but Senanayake could not collect
punched down to long on
flicked past or, rather, under midwicket as Dilshan dives over that one...rare mistake from him
defended back to the bowler

pulled very firmly to midwicket and was it a catch? Yes, looks like a drop but Dilshan is in a bit of bother with his hand and needs some treatment. The right hand is the problem, his bowling hand. Gets some strapping on (which won't be allowed to touch the ball, if he does bowl)
flicked out through midwicket
full on the off stump, firmly driven up to mid-off
a touch wide, slapped at and gets it down to third man

goes for the scoop, misses and bowled! Root going right across his stumps and misses with an attempted scoop, losing his middle stump, embarrassment back on the cards for England. Nice and full and straight from the bowler, and when they miss, you know the rest
decent bumper, Jordan on target under it quickly
very full now on the off stump, nudged up into the off side from the crease
another short one, Jordan under it quickly
back to place a nicely-timed punch through the covers for a couple
around the wicket, off stump, defended in the crease back to the bowler
forward flicking straight to midwicket
down the track, gets a thick inside edge to midwicket trying to just defend
another off side push off the back foot, can't find the gap on this occasion
back and pressing to the bowler this time
yorker and just gets the line wrong, Jordan gets a touch on it and it races to fine leg
back across the stumps, blocking into midwicket

decent length just outside off, it nibbles away a little, and takes a thin edge behind! A fourth for Lakmal what a performance from him today. Jordan pushing half-forward just outside off and getting a feather edge to the keeper who took the catch one-handed, blindfolded singing the sinhalese version of It's A Long Way To Tipperary
another cracker first up, it flies through to the keeper with Tredwell fending a ball off that bounced and left him, no touch this time
full on the off stump, pressed back up the wicket
full length a foot wide of off stump, ignored
tossed up but it drifts down leg
back of a length punched down to long-on
able to steer this wide of the cover fielder
forward lean dropped into the covers
slip in, tighter line and blocked out to point
lean forward and nudged up the bowler's right hand
let's this come on and angles out to point
sharp turn, Woakes backing to leg, it comes off an edge to square leg for a cheap single
a gently chip over the off side field, they pick up a couple wide of long-off
now along the floor down the ground to long-off
trying to aim off side but some turn ensures he can only knock this up the wicket
down the track, some turn cramps Woakes up and he's struck on the glove which rebounds into point
leg stump line clipped wide of mid-on and they get a quick run
leg stump line, flicked out through square leg for a single
skids on and takes the pad to square leg
a tad too short, tries to pull and gets struck on the pad which doesn't run far enough for the extra
chipped off a leading edge down to long-off, Woakes worried for a moment
Tredders looks at this careful strokeplay, steady nudge down to long-on
wider on the crease, angled in and it turns away from the outside edge beating Woakes
hoho Tredders, slog sweep over midwicket, not quite the carry to get a boundary, long-on chased well to his left and flicked it back just in time
around the wicket, carefully nudged to mid-off and they take a quick single
back and slashing out to deep cover to a ball sliding just wide of off stump
gives himself a little room and carves wide of extra cover

forward press, pushed back in the air to the bowler and taken low down! A smart return catch, indecision from the batsman, neither tried to belt it nor carefully steer it and pays the penalty. Innocuous off stump delivery, Woakes just misjudged the stroke and tapped it back a foot from the floor, Dilshan down well for the save
angled in at the pads. Dilly, Dilly, Dilly. He's nothing but keen. This is going so far down a baseball umpire would have said not out, so does Bruce Oxenford. Didn't deter a huge appeal
ooo almost, full outside off, Tredwell drives and gets a thick outside edge but just short of gully
tighter line and dropped into midwicket for an easy run
full, Finn plays a golf shot at it and misses complete, two inches away from off stump
back of a length, dabbed down to long leg
tight off stump line, pressed up to mid-off
slighter wider of off stump, driven down to third man
hello Tredders! Down the track and wallop! Cracked into the grass bank over midwicket
forward just defending back to the bowler

down the track again and up she goes, this has gone noewhere and taken by mid-on! A smart catch because that went a long way up but another chance for Dilshan to celebrate. Not the strike Tredwell was looking for, a top edge high into the sky and that's the ball game
